thread.title: Vienna title success for David Ferrer
thread.title_full: Vienna title success for David Ferrer

title: Vienna title success for David Ferrer
text:
Vienna title success for David Ferrer 25 Oct 2015 17:31:53 
comments 
Spain's David Ferrer took a major step towards clinching one of the two remaining vacancies for the ATP World Tour Finals in London with victory over Steve Johnson in the Erste Bank Open in Vienna. 
Ferrer came from a set down to beat first-time finalist Johnson 4-6 6-4 7-5 and join Kei Nishikori on 3,945 points in joint-seventh place in the race for London. 
Johnson was on course to claim a first win in 10 attempts against a top-10 opponent when he got to within two points of clinching the match at 5-4 on Ferrer's serve in the deciding set, but could not find the finish. 
Ferrer is the first Spaniard to lift the Vienna title since Feliciano Lopez's victory in 2004 and has now captured 26 ATP Tour titles. Related Sport News
